definitions.definition: a chemical element. Silver is a shiny, grey-white precious metal used for making coins, jewellery, beautiful objects, etc.

examples.text: a knife with a polished silver casing
There was a streak of silver in her hair.
the shimmering silver of the moon

definitions.definition: dishes, beautiful objects, etc. that are made of silver

examples.text: They've had to sell the family silver to pay the bills.

definitions.definition: coins that are made of silver or a metal that looks like silver

examples.text: I need £2 in silver for the parking meter.

definitions.definition: a medal that is given to the person or the team that wins the second prize in a race or competition

examples.text: She won silver in last year's championships.
The team won two silvers and a bronze.
Her run was enough to secure silver for the team.
She got a silver in the long jump.
She managed to snatch the silver from the defending champion.

definitions.definition: to give somebody money so that they will do you a favour, especially tell your fortune
every sad or difficult situation has a positive side
if you are given something on a silver platter, you do not have to do much to get it

examples.text: These rich kids expect to have it all handed to them on a silver platter.

wordOrigin: Old English seolfor, of Germanic origin; related to Dutch zilver and German Silber.
